availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Kentucky soldier. Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, native. Married to Nancy Williams. Baker in 1863. Served in the 1st Kentucky Independent Battery (U.S.A.) as private and corporal from June 3, 1861, until sentenced to two years confinement and hard labor for assault and theft at Albany, New York, on November 27, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 515.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0152.
